meanings.definition: To make or become bourgeois in character.
meanings.sent1: The once bohemian neighborhood was slowly bourgeoisified as more upscale shops opened.
meanings.sent2: After moving to the affluent suburb, she quickly bourgeoisified her wardrobe to fit in with her new neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious artist bourgeoisified his art by painting traditional landscapes with a modern twist.
meanings.sent4: Her avant-garde fashion sense was bourgeoisified when she started wearing designer labels.
meanings.sent5: The small town's charm was slowly bourgeoisified by the influx of wealthy residents and fancy restaurants.

meanings.definition: To conform to the standards or values of the bourgeoisie.
meanings.sent1: The young musician bourgeoisified his music by incorporating classical elements into his songs.
meanings.sent2: As she climbed the corporate ladder, she found herself bourgeoisifying her tastes in art and entertainment.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious teenager jokingly told his friends he would bourgeoisify their hangout spot by bringing in fancy decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her unconventional cooking style was bourgeoisified when she started using expensive ingredients from gourmet markets.
meanings.sent5: The once simple cafe began to bourgeoisify its menu by adding dishes with truffle oil and foie gras.
